superbibo: <entryFree id="n46643" type="main" key="su^perbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">after</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:110" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superbificus: <entryFree id="n46644" type="hapax" key="su^perbi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperbĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>superbusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n46644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">proud-making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that renders proud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 58" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superbiloquentia: <entryFree id="n46645" type="hapax" key="su^perbi^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperbĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>superbusloquor</etym>, <sense id="n46645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">haughty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proud speaking</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superbio: <entryFree id="n46646" type="main" key="su^perbi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperbĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>superbus</etym>, <sense id="n46646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be haughty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take pride in</hi> a thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: si habes quod liqueat, neque respondes, superbis, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 94</bibl> Orell. (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">B. and K. and Halm, superbe): ut nostris tumefacta superbiat Umbria libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 63: <cit><quote lang="la">avi nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriis actis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formā multa superbit avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Med. Fac. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis triumviratu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 59, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbire miles, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliare superbit Oenides,</quote> <trans><tr>disdains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:588" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 588</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:17:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 17, 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n46646.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things and in a good sense, <hi rend="ital">to be superb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quae sub Tyriā concha superbit aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 22: <cit><quote lang="la">torus radiis auri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva Phlegraeis exuviis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac (gemma) apud Menandrum et Philemonem fabulae superbiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 33, § 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superbiter: <entryFree id="n46647" type="main" key="su^perbi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperbĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. superbus <sense id="n46647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
superbus: <entryFree id="n46648" type="main" key="su^perbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>super; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(pe/rbios</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n46648.0" n="I" level="1"> In a bad sense, that thinks himself above others, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncivil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supercilious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domineering</hi> (cf.: arrogans, insolens, fastidiosus, vanus, elatus): reges odisse superbos, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1091" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1091</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 236</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 326</bibl></cit>; 10, <pb n="1805" /> <cb n="SUPE" /> 514: <cit><quote lang="la">victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non decet superbum esse hominem servom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freti virtute et viribus superbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbum se praebuit in fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ne superbi (animi) sit aspernari ejusdem liberalitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque meo nunc Superbus incedis malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet superbus ambules pecuniā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opibus superbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum superbiorem te pecunia facit, an quod te imperator consulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudato pavone superbior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 802</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines superbissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 57, 6: eum, qui de suā unius sententiā omnia gerat, superbum judico magis quam sapientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non respondere vereor, ne superbum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 40, 2</bibl></cit>.—In a pun on the literal meaning of super: <hi rend="ital">Merc.</hi> Faciam ego te superbum, nisi hinc abis. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Quonam modo? <hi rend="ital">Merc.</hi> Auferere, non abibis, si ego fustem sumpsero, <hi rend="ital">I will make you</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">one who rides</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is carried</hi>, rather than walks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 201</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46648.1" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things concr. or abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postisque superbos Unguit amaracino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <trans><tr>delicate</tr>, <tr>fastidious</tr>, <tr>squeamish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inguen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 205" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 721" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est inhumana virtus neque immanis neque superba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria, quae naturā insolens et superba est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 29, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">superbissima lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatio vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 48: <cit><quote lang="la">aures quarum est judicium superbissimum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>very severe</tr>, <tr>utterly impartial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet aspera mea natura, difficilis aditus, superba responsa,</quote> <trans><tr>uncivil</tr>, <tr>arrogant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus tu superbissima decreta et preces repudiasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum dicendi genus nihil superbum, nihil elatum saltem ac sublime desideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 37</bibl>.—With foll. <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:374" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 374</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:433" default="NO">12, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:646" default="NO">14, 646</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua multo major multitudo neque excluderetur suffragiis, ne superbum esset, nec valeret nimis, ne esset periculosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superba loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—Superbum est, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46648.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭperbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">surname of the younger Tarquin</hi>, the last king of Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:718 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 718 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46648.3" n="II" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished; splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superb</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (virtus) inter hanc fortunam et illam superba incedit cum magno utriusque contemptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum late regem belloque superbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae virtute et factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:573" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">limina civium potentiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebe superbe lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:2:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes Dolopum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 785</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 509" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:45:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 45, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46648.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46648.5" n="1" level="3"> Superba pira, an excellent kind of pear, perh. <hi rend="ital">the muscatel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl>; cf. superbia, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n46648.6" n="2" level="3"> Olivae, of a very large and plump kind, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46648.7" n="3" level="3"> Herba = chamaemeli, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 23</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">haughtily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proudly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superciliously.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46648.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭ-perbē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7</bibl> (8), 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit> (with crudeliter); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 6</bibl> (with insolenter); 37, 10, 2 (with contemptim); 24, 25, 8 (opp. humiliter); 9, 14; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 10: Rhodii, superbe commemoratis meritis suis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46648.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperbĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">anteclass.</orth>), Naev. and Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 515, 10 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">516, 1</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 180, 40</bibl> Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n46648.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces alicujus superbius accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46648.11" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supercado: <entryFree id="n46649" type="main" key="su^perca^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-cădo</orth>, <itype>cĕcĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 57, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:3:70" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 3, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supercaelestis: <entryFree id="n46650" type="main" key="su^percaelestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-caelestis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is above the heavens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">super-celestial</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 49</bibl>. <cb n="SUPE" /></sense></entryFree>
supercalco: <entryFree id="n46651" type="hapax" key="su^percalco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-calco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stand upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supercerno: <entryFree id="n46652" type="hapax" key="su^percerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-cerno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sift upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram cribris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 74</bibl></cit> (better superincerno).</sense></entryFree>
supercerto: <entryFree id="n46653" type="main" key="su^percerto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-certo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fight over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fight therefor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ep. Jud. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superciliosus: <entryFree id="n46654" type="main" key="su^perci^li^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpercĭlĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>supercilium</etym>, <sense id="n46654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdainful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supercilious; censorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 809</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supercilium: <entryFree id="n46655" type="main" key="su^perci^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-cĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>super and root kal-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kalu/ptw;</foreign> Lat. celāre, to hide, cover; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ku/lon, e)piku/lion,</foreign> eyelid; cf. also, Ang.-Sax. hlid; Engl. lid; Germ. Augenlid</etym>: <sense id="n46655.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">cilium est folliculus, quo oculus tegitur, unde fit supercilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 57, § 157</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n46655.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the eye-brow</hi> (good prose; more freq. in the <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n46655.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex superciliorum aut remissione aut contractione facile judicabimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia abrasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiora superciliis obducta sudorem a capite defluentem depellunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sedeo duris torva superciliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl></cit> (17), 16: <cit><quote lang="la">constricta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad malarum scripturam currentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">balenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 62, 88, § 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO">11, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO">11, 3, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres potissimum supercilia sua attribuerunt ei deae (Junoni Lucinae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 69</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=305" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 305</bibl> ib.— </sense><sense id="n46655.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altero ad frontem sublato, altero ad mentum depresso supercilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altero erecto, altero composito supercilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo supercilio spicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirsutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:93 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 93 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium salit (as a favorable omen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46655.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, the prominent part of a thing, <hi rend="ital">the brow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">clivosi tramitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infimo stare supercilio,</quote> <trans><tr>at the bottom of the projection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 18, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 63</bibl>: supercilium quoddam excelsum nacti, Auct. B. Afr. 58, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 5, 5, § 17</bibl>.—In archit., <hi rend="ital">a projecting moulding over the scotia of a column</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cornice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.; a threshold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 5</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the coast</hi> of the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia ejus sinistra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">the shore</hi> of a river: <cit><quote lang="la">Nili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rheni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46655.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46655.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The nod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta supercilio movens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. ad Ser. 2, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46655.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superciliousness</hi> (class.; mostly <number>sing.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium ac regius spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:62" default="NO">5, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste Catonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone supercilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilii matrona severi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:309" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 309</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contegere libidines fronte et supercilio, non pudore et temperantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supercingo: <entryFree id="n46656" type="hapax" key="su^percingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-cingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in addition</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Heptat. 2:177:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Heptat. 2, 177, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superclaudo: <entryFree id="n46657" type="main" key="su^perclaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-claudo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close up</hi> (late Lat.), Adaman. Locc. Sanct. 1, 15.</sense></entryFree>
supercompono: <entryFree id="n46658" type="hapax" key="su^percompo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-compōno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place together upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on the top</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
superconcido: <entryFree id="n46659" type="hapax" key="su^perconci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-concīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut in pieces over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coliculorum minutias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
supercontego: <entryFree id="n46660" type="main" key="su^perconte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-contĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsos (herbida pondera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:42" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renes tunicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supercorruo: <entryFree id="n46661" type="hapax" key="su^percorru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-corrŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall down thereon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supercreatus: <entryFree id="n46662" type="main" key="su^percre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-crĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [creo], <sense id="n46662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grown on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adventitious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infusio umoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:125" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 125</bibl></cit>; Hilar. Trin. 6, 5.</sense></entryFree>
supercresco: <entryFree id="n46663" type="main" key="su^percresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-cresco</orth>, <itype>crēvi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46663.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46663.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">To grow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcinoma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28, 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <case>dat.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 15</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46663.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna quod supercresceret caritati, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>might join</tr>, <tr>be added to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 5</bibl></cit> 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n46663.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outdo</hi>: municipalem habitum, August. c. Acad. 1, 2. <cb n="SUPE" /></sense></entryFree>
supercubo: <entryFree id="n46664" type="main" key="su^percu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-cŭbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sleep upon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 185, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supercurro: <entryFree id="n46665" type="main" key="su^percurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-curro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n46665.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to run over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">baltei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46665.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">large vectigali (ager),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superdatus: <entryFree id="n46666" type="main" key="su^perda^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperdătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. superdo.</entryFree>
superdeligo: <entryFree id="n46667" type="hapax" key="su^perde_li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-dēlĭgo</orth> (also separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper dēl-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
superdestillo: <entryFree id="n46668" type="main" key="su^perdestillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-destillo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trickle upon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superdico: <entryFree id="n46669" type="main" key="su^perdi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-dīco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to say in addition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
superdimidius: <entryFree id="n46670" type="main" key="su^perdi_mi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-dīmĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>; of a number, <sense id="n46670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half as much more</hi> (i. e. that bears to another the ratio of 3 to 2), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
superdo: <entryFree id="n46671" type="main" key="su^perdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-do</orth>, <itype>dĕdi, dătum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay over</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
super: <entryFree id="n46672" type="main" key="su^per3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (postclass.), <sense id="n46672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: novercam tot liberis, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put over</hi>, Capitol. M. Aur. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercam filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46672.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46676" type="main" key="su^pe^r4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-efflŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to superabound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superfluous</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 14, § <cit><quote lang="la">9: mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 35, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PECVNIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1772, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46676.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be abundantly exalted above</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi supereffluit doctrina Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46677" type="main" key="su^pe^r5"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-effulgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be more than effulgent</hi> (late Lat.), Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1250.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46682" type="main" key="su^pe^r6"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ēmĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overtop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise above</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46682.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor viros supereminet omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 857</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umero undas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas omnes aspis supereminens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46682.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut olivae premantur et jus superemineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba paulum supereminens extra aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 33, § 50</bibl></cit> (al. semper eminens).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrēmĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">rising above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominent; comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Cont. Virg. p. 146</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Aug. Spir. et <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 65.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46693" type="hapax" key="su^pe^r7"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-excellens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superexcellent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46697" type="main" key="su^pe^r8"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-exsulto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to leap up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exult greatly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:92" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex. ad Ep. Jacob. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46701" type="hapax" key="su^per9"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fēto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to conceive anew while still with young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to superfetate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 11, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 55, 81, § 219</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46708" type="main" key="su^per10"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): edepol te vocem (ad cenam) libenter, si superfiat locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <cb n="SUPE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae superfieri possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46713" type="main" key="su^per11" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-flŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46713.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflow</hi> (mostly postAug.; only once in Cic.; syn. redundo). </sense><sense id="n46713.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aeneo vase leniter coquuntur, ne superfluant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons superfluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 28, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superfluentis Nili receptacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (Nilus) immodicus superfluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46713.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46713.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be superabundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to superabound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia non superfluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Helv. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46713.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be superfluous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil neque desit, neque superfluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; so (opp. deesse) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46713.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To have a superabundance</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Venetis Aquileia superfluit armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:606" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redundantes nos et superfluentes juvenili quādam dicendi impunitate et licentiā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orator non satis pressus sed supra modum exsultans et superfluens,</quote> <trans><tr>extravagant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbus et superfluens (sc. divitiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 7</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n46713.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quae dicentur, superfluent aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit> Spald.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46726" type="main" key="su^per12"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-gestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [gero]. * <sense id="n46726.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Carried</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heaped upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n46726.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Covered over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orificium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 237</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46730" type="main" key="su^per13"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-grĕdĭor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpergrădĭor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 68, § 110</bibl>), gressus, 3, <sense id="n46730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gradior</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walk</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">go over</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46730.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capram alteram decubuisse atque ita alteram proculcatae supergressam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46730.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surmount; to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis suae feminas pulchritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem laudem supergressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">8: claritatem parentum animi magnitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus res gestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudele praeceptum, supergressum omnia diritatis exempla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 25</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46730.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To live through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survive</hi> a period of time: <cit><quote lang="la">sexagin ta annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46730.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be superior to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated above</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 32:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 32, 5</bibl></cit>.?*! * </sense><sense id="n46730.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpergrĕ-dĭo</orth>, <itype>dĕre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodecimum aetatis annum supergresserat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 238, 34</bibl></cit> (dub.).— * </sense><sense id="n46730.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpergressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46739" type="main" key="su^per14"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-immĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hang over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overhang</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pastorem Ense sequens nudo superimminet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā superimminente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgineusque pudor zonae superimminet artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 962</bibl></cit>: mons superimminens, Hilar, in Psa. 124, 3.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46741" type="hapax" key="su^per15"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-impendens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [impendeo], <sense id="n46741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">overhanging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 287</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superductio: <entryFree id="n46673" type="main" key="su^perducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-ductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>super-duco</etym>, <sense id="n46673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erasure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 1, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superedo: <entryFree id="n46674" type="hapax" key="su^pe^re^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat besides</hi> or <hi rend="ital">after</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">betae radicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supereffero: <entryFree id="n46675" type="main" key="su^pe^reffe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-effĕro</orth>, ef-ferre, <sense id="n46675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. irreg. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exalt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extol</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 49:30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 49, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superegredior: <entryFree id="n46678" type="main" key="su^pe^re_gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ēgrĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>ĕdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to surmount</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">plebeias opiniones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superelevo: <entryFree id="n46679" type="main" key="su^pe^re_le^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ēlĕvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to raise above</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">se (iniquitates),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Esd. 4, 16, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superemico: <entryFree id="n46680" type="main" key="su^pe^re_mi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ēmĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burst forth over</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">terram (unda),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supereminentia: <entryFree id="n46681" type="main" key="su^pe^re_mi^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrēmĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>super-emineo</etym>, <sense id="n46681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supereminence</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 40" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gest. Pelag. 30:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gest. Pelag. 30, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Parad. 2, 8</bibl>: laudis, Hilar. Trin. 11, 4.</sense></entryFree>
superemorior: <entryFree id="n46683" type="hapax" key="su^pe^re_mo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ēmŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>mŏri</itype>, <sense id="n46683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die upon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superenato: <entryFree id="n46684" type="main" key="su^pe^re_na^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ēnăto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 133</bibl></cit> Cort.: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Diluv. 4, 240</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supererectus: <entryFree id="n46685" type="hapax" key="su^pe^re_rectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ērectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [erigo], <sense id="n46685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing overhead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <trans><tr>vertical</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 10</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
supererogatio: <entryFree id="n46686" type="main" key="su^pe^re_ro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ērŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a payment in addition</hi> (late Lat.), Ps. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supererogo: <entryFree id="n46687" type="hapax" key="su^pe^re_ro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ērŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pay out over and above</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid forte supererogasti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 19, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 10, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superescit: <entryFree id="n46688" type="main" key="su^pe^rescit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrescit</orth>, v. supersum.</entryFree>
superevolo: <entryFree id="n46689" type="main" key="su^pe^re_vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ēvŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly away over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 299</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superexactio: <entryFree id="n46690" type="main" key="su^pe^rexacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrexactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>superexigo</etym>, <sense id="n46690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a demanding over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an excessive demand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 20</bibl>, De superexactionibus.</sense></entryFree>
superexalto: <entryFree id="n46691" type="main" key="su^pe^rexalto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-exalto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exalt</hi> <pb n="1806" /> <cb n="SUPE" /> <hi rend="ital">above others</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 2, 13</bibl>. — <mood>Part.</mood>: <cit><quote lang="la">superexaltatus deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superexcedo: <entryFree id="n46692" type="main" key="su^pe^rexce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-excēdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Specul. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Specul. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superexcurro: <entryFree id="n46694" type="hapax" key="su^pe^rexcurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-excurro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stretch over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:27:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 27, 1, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superexeo: <entryFree id="n46695" type="hapax" key="su^pe^rexe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-exĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to extend over</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 18, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superexigo: <entryFree id="n46696" type="hapax" key="su^pe^rexi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-exĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to demand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exact over and above</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to excess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 55, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superextendo: <entryFree id="n46698" type="main" key="su^pe^rextendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-extendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to cover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquo cutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezek. 37, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46698.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch excessively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 10, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superextollo: <entryFree id="n46699" type="main" key="su^pe^rextollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-extollo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to raise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exalt above</hi> others, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:71:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 71, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superfero: <entryFree id="n46700" type="main" key="su^perfe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fĕro</orth>, <itype>ferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n46700.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put over</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pedem parturienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 103</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swim</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 25, § 58</bibl></cit>; App. de Mundo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 882</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46700.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beyond the time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">periclitari partus, si superferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 133</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46700.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To raise high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry over the head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 25, § 84</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exaggerated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba (with translata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superficialis: <entryFree id="n46702" type="main" key="su^perfi^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperfĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>superficies</etym>, <sense id="n46702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the surface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superficial</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n46702.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>denoting the superficial contents</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Arithm. p. 555</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 3, 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46702.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">superficial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superficiarius: <entryFree id="n46703" type="main" key="su^perfi^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperfĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated on another man</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superficiary</hi> (jurid. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n46703.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:18:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mathematice, ut ita dicam, superficiaria est: in alieno aedificat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 28</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46703.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has a house on another man</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a superficiary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:74" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:18" default="NO">39, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:17:3" default="NO">43, 17, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> al.</sense></entryFree>
superficiens: <entryFree id="n46704" type="main" key="su^perfi^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>super-facio</etym>, <sense id="n46704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superfluous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:1:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 3, 1, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superficies: <entryFree id="n46705" type="main" key="su^perfi^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperfĭcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>super-facies</etym>, <sense id="n46705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the upper side</hi> of a thing, <hi rend="ital">the top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surface.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46705.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">testudinum,</quote> <trans><tr>the upper shell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 24, 28, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 10, 12, § 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sardonychum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>the surface</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <trans><tr>the part that grows above ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:56" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 4, 19, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:13" default="NO">4, 29, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:11:2" default="NO">4, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis,</quote> <trans><tr>the roof</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">*(uperw=|on</foreign> superficies, cenaculum, percula, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabri,</quote> <trans><tr>the upper part</tr>, <tr>in which the light is placed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n46705.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46705.3" n="A" level="2"> Jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a building</hi>, as standing above the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aedes ex duabus rebus constent ex solo et superficie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">De superficiebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:18" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superficiem consules ex senatusconsulto aestimabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:17:3:section=5" default="NO">43, 17, 3, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3286 al.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">Also in the collat. form SVPERFICIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 608, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:3:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 3, 39</bibl>; Kalend. Farnes. ap. Grut. 137, 2; 138, 2.—</sense><sense id="n46705.4" n="B" level="2"> In math., <hi rend="ital">a superficies</hi> (only length and breadth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 48, 108, § 260</bibl>; Rhem. Fann. Pond. 107; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superficium: <entryFree id="n46706" type="main" key="su^perfi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. superficies, II. A.</entryFree>
superfigo: <entryFree id="n46707" type="main" key="su^perfi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fīgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, fixus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten thereupon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superfixa capita hostium portantes redierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 60, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Claud. 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superfixus: <entryFree id="n46709" type="main" key="su^perfixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fixus</orth>, v. superfigo.</entryFree>
superflexus: <entryFree id="n46710" type="hapax" key="su^perflexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-flexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [flecto], <sense id="n46710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
superflorescens: <entryFree id="n46711" type="hapax" key="su^perflo_rescens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-flōrescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [floresco], <sense id="n46711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blossoming all over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi cucumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superflue: <entryFree id="n46712" type="main" key="su^perflu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperflŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. superfluus <sense id="n46712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
superfluo: <entryFree id="n46714" type="main" key="su^perflu^o_" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperflŭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. superfluus <sense id="n46714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
superfluus: <entryFree id="n46715" type="main" key="su^perflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>superfluo</etym>, <sense id="n46715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">running over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflowing</hi> (post-Aug.). * </sense><sense id="n46715.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46715.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46715.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Superfluous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnecessary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenissent forsitan necessaria, nisi et superflua quaesissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Jul. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superfluum et vanum orare pro mortuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 12, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa superflua legisse memini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ant. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46715.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That is left over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus superfluos restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:58:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 58, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum superfluum restituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:58:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 36, 1, 58, § 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperflŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>excrements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:67" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 67</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluously.</hi> ( <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> ) Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-flŭē</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 310</bibl>; Imp. Hon. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:72" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 72 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. adv. Manich. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. adv. Manich. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 27, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46715.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-flŭō</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 51, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 34, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 28" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superforaneus: <entryFree id="n46716" type="main" key="su^perfo^ra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperfŏrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>superforum</etym>, <sense id="n46716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">superfluous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnecessary</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:48" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 48</bibl></cit> (al. supervacaneus): <cit><quote lang="la">super his plura replicare, superforaneum puto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
