cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra II.: se supplicem pro aliquo profiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex ad aliquem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, § <cit><quote lang="la">10: ad opem judicum supplices confugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 33</bibl></cit> (11, 23): <cit><quote lang="la">do manus Supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex populi suffragia capto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi quo die Portus Alexandrea supplex patefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex rogabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46966.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi fierem supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicibus supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 229</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me plurimis pro te supplicem abjeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:185 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 185 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Alcibiades Socrati supplex esset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 32, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46966.3" n="(g)" level="5"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">supplex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a suppliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humble petitioner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in miseros ac supplices misericordiā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nos jacentis ad pedes supplicum voce prohibebis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu supplice digno dignior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:290" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 315" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 315</bibl></cit>; so with a <hi rend="ital">pron. possess.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vester est supplex, judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 70, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex vestrae misericordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui numinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 343" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus inimicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46966.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">manus supplices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 21, 48</bibl></cit> (17, 38): <cit><quote lang="la">manu supplice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:31:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 396</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:424" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-plĭcĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">humbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submissively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppliantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppliciter demisseque respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 481</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:438" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 438</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:10:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 10, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supplicamentum: <entryFree id="n46967" type="main" key="suppli^ca_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplĭcāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>supplico</etym>, <sense id="n46967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious ceremony</hi> (syn. supplicatio; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 266, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 267, 34; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 285</bibl> (7, 21 Orell.).</sense></entryFree>
supplicatio: <entryFree id="n46968" type="main" key="suppli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplĭcātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>; <cb n="SUPP" /> in relig. lang., <sense id="n46968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public prayer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supplication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a religious solemnity</hi> in consequence of certain (fortunate or unfortunate) public events; <hi rend="ital">a day set apart for prayer</hi>, either by way of thanksgiving or of religious humiliation, genuflection (cf. obsecratio): <cit><quote lang="la">atque etiam supplicatio diis immortalibus pro singulari eorum merito meo nomine decreta est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor urbanus supplicationes per dies quinquaginta ad omnia pulvinaria constituat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">decreta ad omnia pulvinaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (prodigiorum) averruncandorum causā supplicationes in biduum senatus decrevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicationem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 47, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes such a supplicatio was decreed in honor of a victorious general to precede his triumph: <cit><quote lang="la">cui uni togato supplicationem senatus decreverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex litteris Caesaris dierum viginti supplicatio a senatu decreta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 90</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 3, 6</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies quindecim supplicatio decreta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatio diem unum Romae, alterum in Capenati agro indicta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem unum supplicatio fuit ob, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quatriduum supplicationes decernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 47, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
supplicator: <entryFree id="n46969" type="main" key="suppli^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplĭcātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>supplico</etym>, <sense id="n46969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that prays humbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suppliant</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 1, 14; Aug. Civ. Dei, 5, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
supplicialis: <entryFree id="n46970" type="main" key="suppli^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>supplicium</etym>, <sense id="n46970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">penal</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppliciter: <entryFree id="n46971" type="main" key="suppli^ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplĭcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. supplex <sense id="n46971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
supplicium: <entryFree id="n46972" type="main" key="suppli^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplĭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>supplex; prop. a kneeling down, either as a suppliant or to receive punishment</etym>. <sense id="n46972.0" n="I" level="1"> As a suppliant. </sense><sense id="n46972.1" n="A" level="2"> In relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">humiliation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a public prayer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supplication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an act of worship</hi> (mostly ante-Aug. and in prose after the Aug. period; not in Cic. or Cæs.; syn.: supplicatio, obsecratio): nunc pergam, ut suppliciis placans caelitum aras expleam, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 398, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos suppliciis, sumptu, votis, donis, Precibus plorans, obsecrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 398:22" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 398, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppliciis votisque fatigare deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 50, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non votis neque suppliciis muliebribus auxilia deorum parantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46972.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a sacrificing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ei (Jovi) acceptum est a perjuris supplicii,</quote> <trans><tr>offering</tr>, <tr>sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suppliciis deorum magnifici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 55, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus suppliciisque deos placare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (boves) ad deorum servant supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum supplicia dis ludique magni ab senatu decernuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl></cit> Nipperd. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vannos onustas aromatis et hujuscemodi suppliciis congerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 265, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 16, 5</bibl>: supplicia veteres quaedam sacrificia a supplicando vocabant, Fest. pp. 308 and 309 Müll. — </sense><sense id="n46972.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, out of the relig. sphere, <hi rend="ital">an humble entreaty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">petition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a supplication</hi> in gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Vagenses fatigati regis suppliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur legatos ad consulem cum suppliciis mittit, qui tantummodo ipsi liberisque vitam peterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46972.4" n="II" level="1"> To receive punishment; hence, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penalty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi> (class. and freq.; usu. of the penalty of death; syn. poena). </sense><sense id="n46972.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabitur pol supplicium mihi de tergo vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:75 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 75 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illi de me supplicium dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:116:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 116, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de homine nobili virgis supplicium crudelissime sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:37:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 37, § 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 45, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere (de aliquo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 28, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:33:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 33, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 18, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem hostibus ad supplicium dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tradi ad supplicium jubere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicio affici,</quote> <trans><tr>to be put to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ad ultimum supplicium progredi necesse habeant,</quote> <trans><tr>to take their own lives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vinculis ac verberibus atque omni supplicio excruciatum necare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo cruciatu supplicioque perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimum ei rei supplicium cum cruciatu constitutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1815" /> <cb n="SUPP" /> talis improborum consensio supplicio omni vindicanda (est), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis supplicii tulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicio culpa reciditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suā manu supplicium persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl></cit> (26): <cit><quote lang="la">luere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium redimere opimā mercede,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46972.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad exquisita supplicia proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper iis (improbis) ante oculos judicia et supplicia versentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad innocentum supplicia descendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia annua pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 14, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppliciis delicta coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subplicia in post futuros conposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">domant impios saeva supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 749" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 383</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supplico: <entryFree id="n46973" type="main" key="suppli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n46973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> supplicassis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 61</bibl>; in tmesi: sub vos placo, Auct. ap. Fest. s. v. sub, p. 309, and s. v. ob, p. 190 Müll.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [supplex], <hi rend="ital">to kneel down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">humble one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beg humbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplicate</hi> (class.; cf.: oro, adoro, precor). </sense><sense id="n46973.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n46973.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui irato supplicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quoiquam supplico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum hunc orabo: huic supplicabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is sibi me supplicaturum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo Romano supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 20, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui summisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Caesari solum, sed etiam amicis ejus omnibus pro te libentissime supplicabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 35</bibl> (11, 25): <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot res sint, quae vestris animis supplicent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicare indignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 367</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si tui nobis potestas saepius fieret, non multum Graecis supplicandum putarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 75</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46973.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicabo, exobsecrabo, ut quemque amicum videro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire domum ad eum, precari, denique supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:3:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precari ab indigno, supplicare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo rem publicam imploravit, nemo supplicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missitare supplicantes legatos, Sall J. 38, 1: Pompeiani querentes supplicavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46973.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod domi'st, numquam ulli supplicabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub vos placo, Auct. ap. Fest. l. l.: imperatores nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:92" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrarios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46973.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to pray to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supplicate</hi> as a god; <hi rend="ital">to pray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilica Lari familiari pro copia supplicet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fano supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a dis supplicans invenire veniam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hostias diis supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus frequens iit supplicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa fana deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molā salsā supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 18, 41, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificio supplicari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 24</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: Metello venienti ture, quasi deo, supplicabatur, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, cujus sepulcrum usquam exstet ... ei publice supplicetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatum totā urbe est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ture nec supplicabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supplicue: <entryFree id="n46974" type="main" key="suppli^cu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplĭcŭē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">humbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submissively</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">respondit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 236, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiis persolutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 269, 27.</sense></entryFree>
supplodo: <entryFree id="n46975" type="main" key="supplo_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-plōdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-plaudo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>si, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stamp</hi> the foot: pedem nemo in illo judicio supplosit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 230</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46975.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46975.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To clap</hi> in token of applause, <hi rend="ital">to applaud</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">male nobis supplaudimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversae parti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pud. 19</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n46975.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To tread under foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supplosio: <entryFree id="n46976" type="main" key="supplo_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplōsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">supplau-sĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supplodo</etym>, <sense id="n46976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stamping</hi> with the feet: <cit><quote lang="la">pedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 59, 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 38, 141</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">80, 278</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:128" default="NO">11, 3, 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppo: <entryFree id="n46977" type="main" key="suppo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sūpo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sīpo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>suppus</etym>, = supino, <sense id="n46977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay on the back</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 200, 33</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 575 Rib.); cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=225:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 225, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:311:6" default="NO">311, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppoenitet: <entryFree id="n46978" type="hapax" key="suppoeni^tet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-poenĭtet</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n46978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. impers.</hi>,<cb n="SUPP" />  <hi rend="ital">to be somewhat sorry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to repent a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et illum furoris et hunc nostrum copiarum suppoenitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppolitor: <entryFree id="n46979" type="hapax" key="suppo^li_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pŏlītor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubber up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polisner</hi>, in mal. part., Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 21</bibl> (dub.; R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fragm. v. 139</bibl>, subolitor).</sense></entryFree>
suppono: <entryFree id="n46980" type="main" key="suppo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pōno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n46980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> supposivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supposivit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> sync. supposta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:90" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 90</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set under</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: submitto, subicio). </sense><sense id="n46980.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46980.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">anatum ova gallinis saepe supponimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orat) sub cratim uti jubeas sese supponi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput et stomachum supponere fontibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem polo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:180" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla oneri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros jugo,</quote> <trans><tr>to yoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivam prelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectis agrestibus ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:803" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massica caelo vina sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agresti fano pecus,</quote> <trans><tr>to place under</tr>, <tr>to drive under cover of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:756" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 756</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tumulo (terrae, humo, etc.),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 9, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae dentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to sow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falcem maturis aristis,</quote> <trans><tr>to apply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 348</bibl></cit>: cultros, <hi rend="ital">to apply</hi> (to the throat of cattle to be slaughtered), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 248</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 492</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedis per ignes Suppositos cineri doloso,</quote> <trans><tr>hidden under</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his igitur rebus subjectis suppositisque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>under the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil ita sublime est . . . Non sit ut inferius suppositumque deo,</quote> <trans><tr>subjected</tr>, <tr>subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46980.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46980.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put in the place of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi> for another person or thing (syn. substituo): <cit><quote lang="la">meliorem, quam ego sum, suppono tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in alicujus locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:28:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 28, § 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 30, § 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quarum (mulierum) locum juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se reum criminibus illis pro rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stannum et aurichalcum pro auro et argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae nostrae vicaria fides amicorum supponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46980.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To substitute falsely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fraudulently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to falsify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) herae meae supposita est parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">puerum, puellam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suppositā personā falsum testamentum obsignandum curaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenta falsa supponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">testamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: quos (equos) daedala Circe Suppositā de matre nothos furata creavit, <hi rend="ital">substituted deceptively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi> (because mortal), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 283</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidat, ne suppositus venias, ac falso nomine poscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 98</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46980.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To place as a pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hypothecate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">lemm.</hi> — </sense><sense id="n46980.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46980.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi> (syn. subjungo): <cit><quote lang="la">huic generi Hermagoras partes quattuor supposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum epistolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 63</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46980.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46980.10" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to make subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera ingenio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:306" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tibi supposui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:36" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 36</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46980.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to esteem less</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latio supposuisse Samon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supportatio: <entryFree id="n46981" type="main" key="supporta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supportātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supporto</etym>, <sense id="n46981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">endurance; bearing</hi> (late Lat.), Anon. (Hilar.) in Job, 1, p. 107.</sense></entryFree>
supportatorium: <entryFree id="n46982" type="main" key="supporta_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supportātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, Ambros. de Noë et Arca, 7, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
supporto: <entryFree id="n46983" type="main" key="supporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-porto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">convey</hi> to a place (class.; perh. not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subveho): operi quaecumque usui sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem frumentariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum commeatumque ex Sequanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; 3, 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus terrestri itinere, navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum (ligna, auxilia), etc., navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 112</bibl>; Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum inde in oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:35" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia hinc in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppositicius: <entryFree id="n46984" type="main" key="suppo^si^ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŏsĭtīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpŏs-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suppono, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n46984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">put in the place of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">substituted.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n46984.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: Hermes supposititius sibi ipsi, <hi rend="ital">is his own substitute</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">he needs no one to replace him in combat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:24:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 24, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46984.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">not genuine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supposititious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 71</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SUPP" /></sense></entryFree>
suppositio: <entryFree id="n46985" type="main" key="suppo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŏsĭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suppono</etym>, <sense id="n46985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">setting under.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n46985.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ovorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46985.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a putting in the place of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">substitution</hi> (of a child): <cit><quote lang="la">pueri, Plaut. Capt. grex 3: puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Cist. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppositionem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 1:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Truc. 2:4:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppositorius: <entryFree id="n46986" type="hapax" key="suppo^si^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŏsĭtōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is placed underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellae (in balneis), i. e. tepidariae (because they are under the frigidariae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Car. 17</bibl></cit> Casaub.</sense></entryFree>
suppositus: <entryFree id="n46987" type="main" key="suppo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŏsĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suppono.</entryFree>
suppostrix: <entryFree id="n46988" type="hapax" key="suppostrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppostrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suppono, I. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n46988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that fraudulently exchanges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">substitutes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppraefectus: <entryFree id="n46989" type="main" key="suppraefectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppraefectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subpraefectus</etym>, <sense id="n46989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-prefect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 359, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46989.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulis ventis binos subpraefectos dant,</quote> <trans><tr>subsidiary winds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppresse: <entryFree id="n46990" type="main" key="suppresse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppressē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. supprimo.</entryFree>
suppressio: <entryFree id="n46991" type="main" key="suppressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppressĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supprimo</etym>, <sense id="n46991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppression</hi>, i. e., * </sense><sense id="n46991.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A keeping back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retaining</hi> of money, <hi rend="ital">embezzlement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae ac suppressiones judiciales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 25, 68</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46991.2" n="II" level="1"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a sense of oppression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the nightmare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 60, § 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppressor: <entryFree id="n46992" type="hapax" key="suppressor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppressor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieni servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:15:6:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 15, 6, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppressus: <entryFree id="n46993" type="main" key="suppressus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppressus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of supprimo.</entryFree>
supprimo: <entryFree id="n46994" type="main" key="suppri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-prĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>pressi, pressum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n46994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46994.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., so rarely and only as a naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send to the bottom</hi> a vessel: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor (naves) suppressae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 30, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46994.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (class.). </sense><sense id="n46994.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep back; to check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put a stop to; to detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppress</hi> (syn.: reprimo, repello, sisto). </sense><sense id="n46994.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem nostros insequentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerii cursūs habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 777</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to close</tr>, <tr>make costive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 280</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit> (4, 9), 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:427" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 427</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <trans><tr>let fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> M 1, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem ultimam vocis In medio sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:193" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jam deficiam, subpressaque lingua palate Vix instillato restituenda mero, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46994.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudinem supprimere nec pati manare longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultiloquium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 113: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem altā mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 228</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46994.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To keep from publicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self; to keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppress</hi> (syn.: abscondo, celo). </sense><sense id="n46994.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (HS DC) reticuit atque suppressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 68</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">26, 71: nummos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elaborata abscondere atque supprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (senatusconsulta) antea arbitrio consulum supprimebantur vitiabanturque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienam ancillam,</quote> <trans><tr>to harbor secretly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:84" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterii foeditate suppressā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46994.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus decreti suppressa fama est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam coërcitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicium conjurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Vespasiani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 96</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">suppres-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">held back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kept in</hi>, i. e., * </sense><sense id="n46994.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Short</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46994.10" n="B" level="2"> Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">subdued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppressā voce dicere (opp. magnā voce dicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:470" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 470</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit ut voce sic etiam oratione suppressior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">suppres-sē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>; in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppressius,</quote> <trans><tr>in a subdued voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ord. 1:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ord. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supprincipalis: <entryFree id="n46995" type="main" key="supprinci^pa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-princĭpālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">next after the first</hi>: sonus supprincipalis principalium, = <foreign lang="greek">parupa/th u(patw=n,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9</bibl>, §§ 931, 941 sq.</sense></entryFree>
suppromus: <entryFree id="n46996" type="main" key="suppro_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-prōmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-butler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 32</bibl>. <pb n="1816" /> <cb n="SUPR" /></sense></entryFree>
suppudet: <entryFree id="n46997" type="main" key="suppu^det"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pŭdet</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n46997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be somewhat ashamed</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">eorum me suppudebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puto te jam suppudere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppurata: <entryFree id="n46998" type="main" key="suppu_ra_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppūrāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. suppuro, II. A.</entryFree>
suppuratio: <entryFree id="n46999" type="main" key="suppu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppūrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suppuro</etym>, <sense id="n46999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purulent gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an imposthume</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abscess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suppuration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 27</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 16, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 7, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:2" default="NO">6, 38, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppuratorius: <entryFree id="n47000" type="hapax" key="suppu_ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppūrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suppurating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppurative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 13, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppuro: <entryFree id="n47001" type="main" key="suppu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pūro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n47001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [pus]. </sense><sense id="n47001.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gather matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form pus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come to a head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppurate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47001.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cancer) fistulosus subtus suppurat sub carne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 14, 16, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:142" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 70, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:152" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 73, § 152</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŭ-rantĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">gatherings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppurating sores</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 58, § 122</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47001.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum voluptates angusto corpori ingestae suppurare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos hasta praetoris infami lucro et quandoque suppuraturo exercet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to become noxious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47001.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring to a head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to suppurate</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n47001.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">suppurated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of matter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sores</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suppurāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 76, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:72" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 3, 35, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:29" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 4, 14, § 29</bibl>; 22, 25, 58, § 124.—</sense><sense id="n47001.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: magnum de modico malum, scorpium terra suppurat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">brings forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produces</hi>, as if by suppuration, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis et suppurata tristitia,</quote> <trans><tr>deepseated</tr>, <tr>festering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppus: <entryFree id="n47002" type="main" key="suppus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (of uncertain signif.; <sense id="n47002.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">acc. to Fest., = supinus): suppum antiqui dicebant, quem nunc supinum dicimus, ex Graeco, videlicet pro aspiratione ponentes S litteram ... Ejus vocabuli meminit etiam Lucilius: si vero das, quod rogat, et si suggeri suppus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=290" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 290</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(jactum) unionem canem, trinionem suppum, quaternionem planum vocabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagari animalia suppa,</quote> <trans><tr>walk inverted</tr>, <tr>head downwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1061</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supputarius: <entryFree id="n47003" type="hapax" key="suppu^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>supputo</etym>, <sense id="n47003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to reckoning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">computation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gesticuli digitorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl></cit> (al. supputatorii, in the same sense).</sense></entryFree>
supputatio: <entryFree id="n47004" type="main" key="suppu^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŭtātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoning up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">computation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 36: stadiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 609</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supputator: <entryFree id="n47005" type="main" key="suppu^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŭtātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">computer</hi>, Firm. Math. 5, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin</hi></sense></entryFree>
supputatorius: <entryFree id="n47006" type="main" key="suppu^ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppŭtātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. supputarius.</entryFree>
supputo: <entryFree id="n47007" type="main" key="suppu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pŭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>). <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n47007.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cut off below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas teneras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castaneam bimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina fruticantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47007.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To count up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compute</hi> (syn. numero); <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitis supputat articulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit> (al. computat): <cit><quote lang="la">numeros mensurasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supra: <entryFree id="n47008" type="main" key="su_^pra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sū^prā</orth> (orig. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrā</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 429</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:672" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 672</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1407" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1407</bibl>; Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 106; cf. Prisc. pp. 980 and 1001 P.), <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>superus</etym>. <sense id="n47008.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the upper side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47008.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia haec, quae supra et subter, unum esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes eae, quae sunt infra quam id, quod devoratur, dilatantur, quae autem supra, contrahuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno numero jumentorum in flumine supra atquo infra constituto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">et mare, quod supra, teneant, quodque alluit infra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum supra siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotem illam et novaculam defossam in comitio supraque impositum puteal accepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto vertice supra est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is taller</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 683</bibl></cit>: ut letata corpora vidit Victoremque supra hostem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stretched over them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 56</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stupet inscia supra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 381</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia superius rapiuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>upward</tr>, <tr>on high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SUPR" /> piscina superius construenda, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 34, 2</bibl> (opp. subterius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 8, 4</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n47008.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47008.3" n="1" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previously</hi> (esp. of any thing previously said or written): <cit><quote lang="la">quae supra scripta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod jam supra tibi ostendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae supra dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae supra scripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem supra deformavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti supra demonstravimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
